fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.nodes

Class ArchiveUnit

  • Object
    • fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.nodes.ArchiveUnit

  • public class ArchiveUnit
extends Object
    Class for SEDA Archive Unit managing metadata, objects, if any, and on disk representation.

    Other classes create Archive Units on the fly with extracted information and content. This class write on disk representation with convenient directory/file structure and manifest.json files for metadata.

    All the files, if not pure binary, are UTF-8 encoded, as the file names.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArchiveUnit

        public ArchiveUnit(StoreExtractor storeExtractor,
                   String rootPath,
                   String name)
        Instantiates a new archive unit.

        This constructor is used for root Archive Unit (no father).

        Parameters:
        storeExtractor - Operation store extractor
        rootPath - Directory in which the directory/file structure is created
        name - Name of the root Archive Unit

      • ArchiveUnit

        public ArchiveUnit(StoreExtractor storeExtractor,
                   ArchiveUnit father,
                   String unitType,
                   String name)
        Instantiates a new archive unit.

        Name is reduced to 32 characters (8 if NAMES_SHORTENED option is enabled), and Archive Unit directory name is generated as "'unitType'#'UniqID':'name' (with unitType first character only if NAMES_SHORTENED option is enabled)

        Parameters:
        storeExtractor - Operation store extractor
        father - Father Archive Unit
        unitType - Unit type (Folder| Message| Attachment)
        name - Name of the Archive Unit

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
        Gets the logger created during the store extractor construction, and used in all mailextract classes.

        For convenience each class which may have some log actions has it's own getLogger method always returning the store extractor logger.

        Returns:
        logger

        Parameters:

        public String getName()
        Gets the name.

      • addMetadata

        public void addMetadata(String key,
                        String value,
                        boolean mandatory)
        Adds a simple (key, value) metadata.

        If value is null or empty, no metadata is added.

        If mandatory flag is true and value is empty, the metadata is set to "". If mandatory flag is true and value is null, the fact is logged

        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        value - Metadata String value
        mandatory - Mandatory flag

      • addMetadata

        public void addMetadata(String key,
                        String attributename,
                        String attributevalue,
                        String value,
                        boolean mandatory)
        Adds a simple (key, value) metadata with an attribute.

        If value is null or empty, no metadata is added.

        If mandatory flag is true and value is empty, the metadata is set to "". If mandatory flag is true and value is null, the fact is logged

        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        attributename - Metadata attribute name
        attributevalue - Metadata attribute value
        value - Metadata String value
        mandatory - Mandatory flag

      • addDefaultValuedMetadata

        public void addDefaultValuedMetadata(String key,
                                     String value,
                                     String defaultValue)
        Adds a simple (key, value) metadata with a default value if value is null or empty.
        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        value - Metadata value
        defaultValue - Default metadata value

      • addSameMetadataList

        public void addSameMetadataList(String key,
                                java.util.List<String> valuesList,
                                boolean mandatory)
        Adds a list of (key, value) metadata for the same key .

        If list of values is null or empty, no metadata is added.

        If mandatory flag is true and list of values is null or empty, the metadata lack is logged

        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        valuesList - Metadata list of values
        mandatory - Mandatory flag

      • addPersonMetadata

        public void addPersonMetadata(String key,
                              String value,
                              boolean mandatory)
        Adds for the key metadata a person value

        This is a utility method, used first for the writer. For example the due structure for "TOTO" Writer metadata in XML is:

        TOTO toto@sample.fr

        If mandatory flag is true and value is null or empty, the metadata lack is logged

        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        value - Person value
        mandatory - Mandatory flag

      • addEventMetadata

        public void addEventMetadata(String identifier,
                             String type,
                             String dateTime,
                             String detail)
        Adds an event value.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the event identifier
        type - the event type
        dateTime - the event date time
        detail - the event detail

      • addPersonMetadataList

        public void addPersonMetadataList(String key,
                                  java.util.List<String> valuesList,
                                  boolean mandatory)
        Adds for the key metadata an array of person values, with values in valuesList

        This is a utility method, used first for the addresses list. For example the due structure for "TOTO" Addressee metadata in XML is:

        TOTO toto@sample.fr

        If valuesList is null or empty, no metadata is added.

        If mandatory flag is true and value is null or empty, the metadata lack is logged

        Parameters:
        key - Metadata key
        valuesList - Values list
        mandatory - Mandatory flag

      • addObject

        public void addObject(String stringContent,
                      String filename,
                      String usage,
                      int version)
        Adds an object with content from a String.

        This object will be saved to disk UTF-8 encoded.

        Parameters:
        stringContent - Object content
        filename - File name
        usage - Usage type (BinaryMaster| TextContent...)
        version - Object version (usually 1)

      • addObject

        public void addObject(byte[] byteContent,
                      String filename,
                      String usage,
                      int version)
        Adds an object with content from a byte array.

        This object will be saved to disk in raw binary format.

        Parameters:
        byteContent - Object content
        filename - File name
        usage - Usage type (BinaryMaster| TextContent...)
        version - Object version (usually 1)

      • write

        public void write()
           throws ExtractionException
        Write the Archive Unit representation on disk.
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)
